description: Took to this immediately. Very impressive, intuitive and very good on first blush, and I suspect will serve me nicely.
I have an i3 laptop with a spinning rust drive and 8gb of memory, and this app managed to hard-lock my system; which is something no other Linux app has managed to do.
Works as avertised. Could use some more features and better error handling.

Cumulonimbus comes close to being my perfect podcast app. Unfortunately the interface is so slow it's unusable. I have a 10th gen i5, everything else on my system is instantaneous. Cumulonimbus takes 30secs -1 min to switch between tabs, load a podcast preview, etc. Sadly uninstalling and looking for something better.

- Aimple but intuitive interface. 
- Ability to search (and response fast) and details/subscribe to podcast is a great feature
- Dark mode, shortcuts
- Displaying show notes with play is awesome
- Not seen slowness as others are writing about.
summary: clean interface, search subscribe to podcasts is great

description: Allows searching, streaming and downloading podcasts. It has a nice simple GUI
